title: Local Operators as the New Media Channel
highlights: Local public media inventory is expanding due to bridge funding and stabilization grants, creating short-flight sponsorship slots and higher-trust reach you can buy quickly [^2][^3][^4].
Programmatic hyper-local CTV lets you control frequency and geos for predictable incremental lifts and cleaner matched-control measurement at scale [^8].
Use station-level promo codes or QR landing pages tied to store geos to convert impressions to footfall and protect event CPA while testing promo depth versus event-driven demand.
executive_summary: You must lift store foot traffic and buyer share in the early holiday window without blanket discounts, and deliver measurable results inside two planning cycles. Target **10-15%** foot-traffic uplift with a stretch goal of **≥25%**, grow early-window share from current 12–15% toward **20-30%**, and hold event CPA at or below **0.80×** baseline while driving at least 5% QR redemption of footfall. Favor a store-as-studio / media-led holiday that pairs local public media sponsorships with programmatic hyper-local CTV; partnerships, procurement, and store ops must secure Nov 28–Dec 12 short flights with station-level promo codes or QR landing pages in the next 30 days so you can measure incremental footfall and CPA. Measure success by tracking buyer activity share versus promo intensity and QR redemptions per geo, using matched control areas for attribution [^2][^3][^4][^8].
top_operator_moves: Call top local public stations in priority DMAs this week and buy Nov 28–Dec 12 sponsorships with unique promo codes or QR redirects tied to specific stores.
Run a small programmatic hyper-local CTV flight across priority trade areas with matched control geos and cap event CPA at **0.80×** baseline to protect ROI.
Instrument QR redemptions, station-level code redemptions, dwell estimates, and buyer activity share; report buyer share versus promo intensity daily to commerce and store-ops owners.
